Issues.Title: Missing System.Drawing.Common NuGet package for .NET 8 Preview 6 and newer.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8 Preview 6 and newer.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Last available NuGet package is targeting .NET 8 Preview 5

### Issue description

There haven't been any new preview packages for System.Draing.Common since .NET 8 preview 5: https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.Drawing.Common/8.0.0-preview.5.23280.5

Is this simply an oversight or is the package effectively deprecated? Related to the migration from runtime to winforms?

### Steps to reproduce

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing System.Drawing.Common NuGet package for .NET 8 Preview 6 and newer." (#9689)

Issues.Title: Issus 4908 port save file dialog designer and folder browser dialog designer
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #4908 


## Proposed changes

- Port SaveFileDialogDesigner and FolderBrowserDialogDesigner to runtime

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- SaveFileDialogDesigner and FolderBrowserDialogDesigner can be designed in runtime

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### After

![AfterChang](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/509d4ada-21fc-41b8-9ee4-35af64941186)



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually (added SaveFileDialogDesigner and FolderBrowserDialogDesigner to DemoConsole test app)

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 8.0.100-rc.1.23407.2

Issues.Title: Investigate `.editorconfig` setting for xml comment indentation
Issues.Body: The code style of two spaces for xml comment content should be enforced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Investigate `.editorconfig` setting for xml comment indentation" (#9680)

Issues.Title: Don't serialize Hashtable with custom comparer
Issues.Body:
We don't support `Hashtable` manual serialization with custom comparers or hash code generators. Check for this case and allow it to fall through to the `BinaryFormatter`.  Add a few tests to validate.

Also move `BinaryFormatReader` code to `BinaryReaderExtensions`.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9679)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Don't serialize Hashtable with custom comparer" (#9679)

Issues.Title: Form with FormBorderStyle = None adds additional height when height is small
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

_No response_

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

I create Form with FormBorderStyle = None. When height of this Form is small, additional height is added. If height of Form is big enough, resulting height is OK.

That is what I see in Designer:

![1) What I see in Designer](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45461294/6c068ebf-0de2-4d48-929f-8ea215669cee)

That is what I get when run:

![2) What I get when run](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45461294/a14f9e71-2033-4011-80de-0f6a61b4c8bb)

I see additional 15 pixels below TextBox. Why do I get it? I need exact certain height.

### Steps to reproduce

Repository that reproduce it, is here:

[https://github.com/mikola-akbal/Form-Minimal-Height-Is-Greater-Than-Zero](https://github.com/mikola-akbal/Form-Minimal-Height-Is-Greater-Than-Zero)

There are screen-saves too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Form with FormBorderStyle = None adds additional height when height is small" (#9671)

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

`.net 6.0` is OK.

### Issue description

open `winform` apps slow, need wait 5+ seconds, actually `wpf` same too;
close also slow, the process need 6+ seconds to stop.

### Steps to reproduce

as `description` said.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".net7.0 winform slow on windows7" (#9666)

Issues.Title: Localized file check-in by OneLocBuild Task: Build definition ID 164: Build ID 2237741
Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/icxLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

Issues.Title: Merge main into feature/9.0 branch - 8/7/2023
Issues.Body:
Merge main into feature/9.0 branch manually following the steps:

1. `git pull origin feature/9.0`
2. `git checkout main`	
3. `git merge feature/9.0`	 There are some conflicts on 3 files (eng/Version.Details.xml, eng/Versions.props, global.json), these conflicts because of the commit [9675](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9675/commits/bb80c8dcb9df853e116d4eaba442c86b62273f72), to resolve these conflicts, I picked the code of main branch

1. `git push -u origin main`

Issues.Title: TextRenderer.MeasureText() returns wrong value
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

TextRenderer.MeasureText() returns size that is wrong. If I use this size as width of DataGridView.Column, the text is truncated, the width of column is not enough for this text. When displaying text in TextBox, it's the same.

On the screen-save below you see Text_Size = {Width=407, Height=16}, calculated by TextRenderer.MeasureText(). You see - width 407 is less then actual 449 when TextBox and DataGridView render this text. This creates problems for placement of controls. I can not know exact size that control need to display whole text.

![Measure](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45461294/6ed32c09-18e6-45a2-9513-4a7f1fc824f7)


### Steps to reproduce

Repository that reproduces it, is here:

[https://github.com/mikola-akbal/TextRenderer-MeasureText-Returns-Not-Certain-Value](https://github.com/mikola-akbal/TextRenderer-MeasureText-Returns-Not-Certain-Value)

It contains this screen-save too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TextRenderer.MeasureText() returns wrong value" (#9672)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in StronglyTypedResourceBuilder
Issues.Body:
I had to fix nullable annotations of `ResXDataNode` in the process. This class was annotated for .Net 8, so it's not too late to make the changes without too much hassle.
I also unearthed quite a few problems in the annotations of System.CodeDom that forced me to use the null forgiving operator more than I should normally have to.

## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `StronglyTypedResourceBuilder`

Issues.Title: [LOC] Don't translate End and Insert keys in KeysConverter for German.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-rc.1.23403.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

**Current Behavior:** End and Insert keys are not translated.
.NET 8.0.100-rc.1.23403.2: 
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/1d79f560-dec4-45ab-85e0-35fdc8472a9d)

**Expected Behavior:** End and Insert keys are translated.
.NET Framework 4.8.1:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/2b0291aa-80ac-46e5-a63d-ade528cb8564)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core project.
2. Drag MenuStrip control to form designer.
3. Set the Type Here in MenuStrip as below:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/8195394a-bf75-45ee-b958-959597721da5)
4. Set the ShortcutKeys = Ctrl+End  in toolStripMenuItem1 property window.
5. Set the ShortcutKeys = Ctrl+Insert  in toolStripMenuItem2 property window.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[LOC] Don't translate End and Insert keys in KeysConverter for German." (#9660)
